p: Depression during ASCT hospitalization has been associated with higher levels of post‐traumatic stress disorder, lower quality of life, and enduring depression in the months and years following the transplant. 5, 6, 7 Furthermore, clinical depression following ASCT predicts mortality; 3, 8 one study found that patients with major depression were three times more likely to die between 6 and 12 months following ASCT than those without major depression. 8
